body_html:
1. That's not too bad I think. We can always have a .detach_loss() method that would give you AdaptiveSoftmax corresponding to what you learned.
  2. Right. I'll need to think about it a bit more, but I really think that having a flag for this isn't a good solution.
body_text:
That's not too bad I think. We can always have a .detach_loss() method that would give you AdaptiveSoftmax corresponding to what you learned.
Right. I'll need to think about it a bit more, but I really think that having a flag for this isn't a good solution.
body:
1. That's not too bad I think. We can always have a `.detach_loss()` method that would give you `AdaptiveSoftmax` corresponding to what you learned.
2. Right. I'll need to think about it a bit more, but I really think that having a flag for this isn't a good solution.
